function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Vector-borne diseases and zoonotic diseases are implicated, disproportionately impacting people in tropical climates with inadequate access to health services, poor housing, weak governance structures, and socio-economic underdevelopment.","Impact":"Major epidemics impact regional economic productivity and enact a quieter 'hidden' endemic toll on local communities, perpetuating poverty, disability, malnutrition, and social isolation.","Mitigation":"Improving access to health services, addressing housing conditions, strengthening governance structures, and promoting socio-economic development.","Technologies":"Improved health infrastructure, vector control measures, and public health education.","People":"People in tropical climates with inadequate access to health services, poor housing, weak governance structures, and socio-economic underdevelopment.","Owner":"Health organizations, government agencies, and community stakeholders"},{"Description":"Uneven distribution of progress in tackling vector-borne diseases (VBDs) across the world and across all diseases.","Impact":"Unequal burden of VBDs and uneven progress in disease control.","Mitigation":"Equitable distribution of resources, funding, and healthcare interventions to address VBDs globally.","Technologies":"Healthcare infrastructure, disease surveillance systems, and international collaboration.","People":"Populations affected by VBDs globally.","Owner":"International health organizations, governments, and global health partnerships"},{"Description":"Emerging vector-borne diseases, such as Zika virus (ZIKV) and Chikungunya (CHIK), have infected millions and are linked to neurological and developmental disorders in infants.","Impact":"Increased health risks and developmental disorders in affected populations.","Mitigation":"Vector control measures, disease surveillance, and public health education to prevent and respond to emerging VBDs.","Technologies":"Advanced disease surveillance technologies, vaccine development, and vector control innovations.","People":"Populations at risk of emerging VBDs, particularly in affected regions.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, and governmental health departments"}]}
